quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), National Organ and Tissue Transplant Organization (NOTTO) had organized the 13th Indian Organ Donation Day (IODD) celebrations on 3rd August 2023. To encourage organ donation, the Government of India has increased the leave duration for organ donors from 30 days to ____ days.
options: 45 days
60 days
70 days
50 days
90 days

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), which of the following institutes has developed the first of its kind Haemophilia A and von Willebrand Disease Diagnostic Kits?
options: ICMR-National Institute of Pathology
ICMR Vector Control Research Centre
ICMR-National Institute of Epidemiology
ICMR- National Institute of Immunohematology
ICMR-National Institute of Virology

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to NEVF?a) It is a category II Venture Capital Fund b) It is monitored by Securities & Exchange Board of Indiac) It is a close ended fund
options: only a
only b
only c
both a and b
both a and c

quiz.text: The target corpus of NEVF is Rs 100 crore. Match the following based on the contribution to target corpusA. SIDBI   1. Rs 45 croreB. MDoNER  2. Rs 30 croreC. NEDFi  3. Rs 25 crore
options: A-1; B-2; C-3
A-3; B-1; C-2
A-2; B-1; C-3
A-3; B-2; C-3
A-2; B-3; C-1

quiz.text: Identify ‘X’ based on the following statementsa) Three pillars of ‘X’ are political and security co-operation, economic and financial co-operation, &  cultural and people to people co-operationb) South Africa holds the Presidency of ‘X’ for the year 2023.
options: IBSA (India, Brazil, South Africa) Dialogue Forum
Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa (BRICS)
Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO)
Southern African Development Community (SADC)
Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS)

quiz.text: Identify ‘X’ through the following statementsa) The overall objective of ‘X’ is to help its members use trade as a means to raise living standards, create jobs and improve people's lives.b) ‘X’ was established through Marrakesh Agreement.
options: World Bank
International Monetary Fund
World Trade Organization
United Nations
None of the above.

quiz.text: Which of the following countries has proposed ’30 for 30’ initiative to the World Trade Organization?
options: Germany
France
Canada
United States
India

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has launched the second phase of the annual Nationwide Mass Drug Administration (MDA) initiative for Lymphatic Filariasis. It will cover 81 districts in 9 endemic States.  The Government of India has set ____ as target year to eliminate Lymphatic Filariasis from India.
options: 2025
2024
2027
2028
2030

quiz.text: Identify the incorrect statement(s) with respect to the above-mentioned initiative.a) The initiative envisages to provide industry relevant skill training programmes to 2.5 lakhs youth of the NER through a wide array of schemes and initiatives.b) The Financial Allocation towards the programme is Rs 500 crore.c) The Initiative is launched by the Ministry of Development of North-East Region.
options: only a
only b
both b and c
both a and c
only c

quiz.text: Identify the correct statement(s) with regards to the training activities included under the initiativea) 30,000 to be skilled under Jan Shikshan Sansthans (JSS)b) 2 Lakh skill training under Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)c) 20,000 Apprenticeship Engagement under National Apprenticeship Promotion Scheme (NAPS)
options: only a
only b
only c
both a and b
both a and c

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), the Standing committee on Statistics (SCoS) has replaced the Standing Committee on Economic Statistics. It will advise Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) on all surveys. Who among the following chairs the Standing committee on Statistics (SCoS)?
options: Rao Inderjit Singh
Dr. G. P. Samanta
B.V.R. Subrahmanyam
G. Srinivas
Pronab Sen

quiz.text: The National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC) is organizing awareness camps to create awareness & sensitize its target group regarding its schemes.  NSKFDC is reimbursing upto _____ per camp for organizing the Awareness Camps to its implementing agency.
options: Rs. 30,000/-
Rs. 15,000/-
Rs. 10,000/-
Rs 25,000/-
Rs. 20,000/-

quiz.text: In February 2023, the largest order valued at over Rs 20,000 Crore was placed at GeM. Which of the following organizations have placed that order?
options: SAIL
Indian Oil
NTPC
GAIL
None of the above

quiz.text: Identify the correct statements with respect to GeM portal.a) GeM achieved a milestone of Rs 2 lakh crore in Gross Merchandise Value (GMV) for the fiscal year 2022-23.b) GeM has enabled Government to save over Rs 45,000 crore since 2016c) The GMV has surpassed  Rs 4.5 crore since inception.
options: only a
only b
both a and b
both a and c
All the three statements are correct

quiz.text: Identify the correct statement(s) with regard to e-shram portala) Unorganized workers can self-register themselves through e-shram portal & UMANG appb) Unorganized workers aged between 16-49 years can register in the portal to avail social security benefits.C) Once registered, an unorganized worker will be assigned a 10-digit Universal Account Number (UAN).
options: only a
only b
both a and b
both a and c
All the three statements are correct

quiz.text: Identify the incorrect statement(s) with regard to the benefits offered to unorganized workers through e-shram portala) Rs 2 lakh insurance coverage for death or permanent disabilityb) Rs 1 lakh insurance coverage for partial disabilityc) Rs 5,000 Pension per month after attaining 60 years
options: only a
only b
only c
both a and b
both a and c

quiz.text: The Ministry of Railways is working on an initiative called Janjatiya Gaurav Corridor. It is a comprehensive initiative designed to inject railway connectivity and infrastructure into tribal-dominated regions. Budget allocation for FY 2023-24 towards Janjatiya Gaurav Corridor is _______.
options: Rs 50,000 Crore
Rs 30,000 Crore
Rs 70,000 Crore
Rs 45,000 Crore
Rs 60,000 Crore

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) Academy has become the 10th member of Interpol Global Academy Network (IGAN). IGAN is led by INTERPOL’s Capacity Building and Training Directorate. India Joined Interpol in which of the following years?
options: 1957
1949
1964
1952
1948

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), the Government of India has increased the windfall profit tax on domestically produced crude oil and diesel exports. Which of the following statement (s)  is/ are incorrect with respect to windfall tax?a) A windfall tax is levied on domestic crude oil if rates of the global benchmark rise above USD 75 per barrel.b) Export of diesel, ATF and petrol attract windfall tax if product cracks (or margins) rise above  USD 20 per barrelC) Windfall tax rates are reviewed every week.
options: only a
only b
only c
both a and b
both

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has imposed a ban on the manufacturing, sale, and distribution of Ketoprofen and Aceclofenac, citing ________.
options: risks to newborn child’s health.
risks to pregnant women’s health.
lack of therapeutic relevance.
potential ecological damage.
None of the above.

quiz.text: Central Ground Water Board (CGWB) monitors groundwater levels throughout the country on a regional scale. Groundwater (GW) level data collected by the CGWB for the entire country as of Nov 2022 shows around 88.7 % of monitored wells have water level up to 10m, however some states have depth to water level beyond 40m. Which of the following is not one of them?
options: Haryana
Punjab
Rajasthan
Uttarakhand
Gujrat

quiz.text: With respect to recent (August 2023) initiative of Coal/ Lignite PSUs to support India’s NDC commitment towards creation of additional carbon sink of 2.5 to 3 billion ton of CO2 equivalent through additional forest and tree cover, which of the following statement is/are correct?A) Coal/Lignite PSUs have also identified about 2838 Ha afforested non-forest de-coaled land so far for compensatory afforestation as per the Accredited Compensatory Afforestation (ACA) guidelines.B) ACA guidelines allow project developers to purchase afforested land from private or public entities. This is done as a way of “compensating” for forest land lost to non-forest activity.C) ACA guidelines were introduced by the Forest Rights Act (FRA), 2006.
options: A and B only
A and C only
B and C only
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: In a recent (August 2023) Gazette Notification, the Central Government has announced an extension of self-certification for Solar Photovoltaic (SPV) inverters under the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) Quality Control Order 2017 until _______.
options: 31st November 2023
31st December 2023
31st March 2024
31st April 2024
31st June 2024

quiz.text: In a significant step towards enhancing healthcare quality and aligning dental education with global standards, the Parliament has recently (August 2023) passed the National Dental Commission Bill, 2023. The National Dental Commission (NDC) to be constituted under it will replace the existing Dental Council of India (DCI). The NDC Chairman and Members to be appointed through a merit-based selection process conducted by a search-cum-selection committee chaired by the ________.
options: Union Minister of Health and Family Welfare
Union Health Secretary
Directorate General of Health Services
Cabinet Secretary
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is/are correct with respect to recently (August 2023) passed Digital Personal Data Protection Bill, 2023? A) Personal data may be processed only after obtaining the consent of the individual. For individuals above 18 years of age, it will be provided by the parent or the legal guardian.B) Data principal is an individual whose data is being processed and data fiduciaries is an entity determining the purpose and means of processing.C) Failure to take reasonable security safeguards to prevent data breaches entails up to Rs 250 crore penalty, while non-fulfilment of obligations to give Data Protection Board of India and individuals notice of data breach draws penalty of up to Rs 200 crore.
options: A and B only
A and C only
B and C only
B only
All of the above

quiz.text: The Coastal Aquaculture Authority (Amendment) Bill, 2023 has been recently (August 2023) passed by the Parliament. Under this bill establishments like hatcheries, Broodstock multiplication centers (BMC) and Nucleus Breeding Centres (NBC) are now permitted to operate within ________ from the High Tide Line (HTL).
options: 400 meters
300 meters
250 meters
200 meters
500 meters

quiz.text: Finance commission (FC) determines the allocation of the SDRF of each State for each of the financial years for entire Award period. As against Rs. 61,220 crores recommended by the 14th FC for the Award Period (2015-16 to 2019-2020) the 15th FC has allocated a total corpus of______ in State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) to all States for the Award Period (2021-22 to 2025-2026).
options: Rs. 1,28,122.40 crore
Rs. 1,38,122.40 crore
Rs. 1,48,122.40 crore
Rs. 1,58,122.40 crore
None of the above

quiz.text: In _______, a dedicated ASEAN India S&T Development Fund (AISTDF) with an equivalent amount of _______ USD was established jointly by the Ministry of External Affairs and Department of Science and Technology (DST) to support R&D projects and associated project development activities.
options: 2002, 1 million
2004, 5 million
2008, 5 million
2008, 1 million
None of the above.

quiz.text: The government recently (August 2023) directed all pharmaceutical companies in the country to implement the revised Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), bringing their processes at par with global standards. Identify incorrect statement with respect to it-A) Larger companies with a turnover of over Rs 250 crore have been asked to implement the changes within six months, while medium and small-scale enterprises with turnover of less than Rs 250 crore have been asked to do so within a year.B) Schedule M of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940, deals with GMP for pharmaceutical manufacturing units, including specific norms pertaining to premises, plant and equipment.C) Timeline for completion of GMP norms begins from August 1.
options: A only
B only
C only
None of the above
All of the above

quiz.text: Data from the Directorate General of Commercial Intelligence and Statistics indicated that the share of MSME products in India’s total exports experienced a decline over the past three years. In the fiscal year 2020-21, MSME products constituted 49.4% of India’s exports, which decreased to 45.0% in 2021-22 and further to ________ in 2022-23.
options: 40.6%
41.6%
42.6%
43.6%
None of the above

quiz.text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has recently (August 2023) imposed late submission fees amounting to ₹2,000 crore on four major public sector undertakings for failing to promptly report their overseas investments. Which one of the following is not one of them?
options: ONGC Videsh Ltd
Indian Oil Corp. Ltd
GAIL (India) Ltd
Oil India Ltd
None of the above

quiz.text: Nationwide Digital Life Certificate (DLC) Campaign 2.0. seen in the news recently (August 2023), which of the following statement with respect to this campaign is incorrect?
options: It is an initiative of the Department of Pension & Pensioners’ Welfare (DOPPW).
It is an initiative of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.
The campaign is set to take place from 1st to 30th November 2023 in 100 cities across India.
The previous campaign was held in November 2022 with over 35 lakh DLC in 37 cities throughout the country.
None of the above

quiz.text: What change has been introduced to resolve the issue of parties being reluctant to pay mediator fees for consumer dispute mediation under the Consumer Protection Act, 2019?
options: Mediation fees have been entirely waived for consumer complaints.
Mediation fees now equally shared by the parties involved in the dispute.
Mediators are now required to conduct mediation sessions without any fees.
The Consumer Welfare Fund will cover the mediator's fee from the interest accrued.
None of the above

quiz.text: “Drone ki Udaan” initiative is to be carried out by which of the following?
options: Airports Authority of India
Ministry of Civil Aviation
Atal Innovation Mission
Self-Help Groups (SHGs)
None of the above

quiz.text: The recent (August 2023) G20 Agriculture Ministers' Meeting held in Hyderabad focused on various aspects of agriculture. What notable outcome was achieved during this meeting?
options: The launch of the "Millet Mission" for sustainable agricultural practices.
Agreement on the "Deccan High-Level Principles" for climate-smart agriculture.
Establishment of the "Digital Agri-Value Chain Alliance" for rural development.
Adoption of the G20 Sustainable Farming Principles.
Acceptance of the 7 Deccan High-Level Principles on Food Security and Nutrition.

quiz.text: A G-20 Finance Track Seminar was recently (August 2023) held as a part of the International Financial Architecture (IFA) and the Frameworks Working Group under India's G-20 Presidency. What was the theme of this seminar and which Indian organizations were involved in organizing this seminar?
options: Theme: Enhancing Digital Financial Inclusion & Organizers: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) and National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI)
Theme: Enhancing Digital Financial Inclusion & Organizers: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI)
Theme: Global Economy: Challenges, Opportunities and the Way Forward & Organizers: Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance and Reserve Bank of India
Theme: Climate Change Mitigation and Sustainable Finance | Organizers: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change and The United Nations Environment Programme
None of the above.

quiz.text: With respect to recently (August 2023) convened G20 side events across the country, which of the following is/are correctly matched?A) 3rd G20 Anti-Corruption Working Group (ACWG) - Kolkata B) 2nd G20 Anti-Corruption Ministerial Meet – New Delhi C) G20 Finance Track Seminar - Mumbai
options: A and B only
A and C only
B and C only
B only
All of the above

quiz.text: The National Industrial Corridor Development & Implementation Trust (NICDIT) seen in the news recently (August 2023), which of the following statement with respect to NICDIT is incorrect?
options: The NICDIT is responsible for providing funds and coordinating efforts for the development of Industrial Corridor Projects in India.
It operates under the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)
NICDIT originated in 2007 as the Delhi Mumbai Industrial Corridor Project Implementation Trust Fund (DMIC-PITF).
Currently NICDIT is overseeing the development of 15 industrial corridors across the country.
None of the above

quiz.text: The Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways recently (August 2023) informed about the current developments with respect to Vehicle Scrappage Policy. Which of the following statement with respect to Vehicle Scrappage Policy is/are incorrect?
options: Public Vehicles belonging to the Centre and State Government, that are more than 15 years old, shall be scrapped.
Vehicles used by citizens to commute will be de-registered after 20 years if found unfit.
After completion of 15 years, the commercial vehicles will need to undergo a fitness test.
Vehicle owners are eligible for concession in motor vehicle tax of up to 25% for private vehicles and up to 15% for commercial Vehicles which are purchased against Certificate of Deposit.
None of the above

quiz.text: Indian Space Policy of 2023 is a comprehensive framework that aims to promote and regulate space activities in India. It includes - A) Non-Government Entities (NGE) can undertake end-to-end activities, establish space objects, ground-based assets, can offer related services like communication, remote sensing, navigation, satellite control. B) Role of ISRO would be to focus on R&D, technology development, and applications.C) Department of Space (DOS) to coordinate dispute resolution and ensures safe and sustainable space operations.
options: A and B only
A and C only
A only
B and C only
All of the above

quiz.text: ‘Antara Programme’ and ‘Chhaya’ are seen in the news recently (August 2023), these initiatives are related to which of the following?
options: Initiatives to promote classical Indian drama.
Initiatives to promote classical Indian music.
Skilling initiative for destitute homeless women.
Birth control initiatives.
none of the above.

quiz.text: The Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare recently (August 2023) inaugurated the Fourth National Conference on the Electronic Resources in Medicine (ERMED) Consortium. Identify the correct statement with respect to it.
options: This Conference was held at Chandigarh.
National Medical Library’s Electronic Resources in Medicine (NML-ERMED) Consortium is an initiative undertaken to develop nation-wide electronic information resources in the field of medicine.
Electronic Resources in Medicine (NML-ERMED) Consortium access facility has been extended to all the medical institutes across the country.
None of the above
All of the above

quiz.text: The RBI has introduced the External Benchmarks Lending Rate system for home loans from October 1, 2019. Under which, all floating rate-based loans were required to be linked to an external benchmark. There are four external benchmarks are set, which of the following is not one of them?
options: RBI's Repo Rate.
RBI's Reverse Repo Rate.
Government of India three-months Treasury Bill yield published by the Financial Benchmarks India Private Ltd. (FBIL)
Government of India six-months Treasury Bill yield published by the FBIL.
None of the above
